WRITING.TEXT:
She's always been a bit of a side character, like Rosita.
I don't think we need fan favorites to sustain the show. They can make new fan favorites, and there are plenty of them already. They need more Glenn moments, multiple per season.
Yeah. At least Kingdom had armor and the McPoyles look like garbage dwellers. The Saviors and Alexandria and Hilltop people are all indistinguishable, though.
Plot armor.

I was really pumped to see him explode. I love his character, but I really needed him to die in this episode. He made that comment to Sasha, something like, "If they get themselves killed, that's on them. It's the result of their actions." And so I loved the idea that he would die simply because he picked the wrong side.
So I was disappointed the explosives didn't go off. Honestly, they could have done without the McPoyles and started their attack on Negan by exploding Eugene and taking out a few saviors before Negan calls for a ceasefire and reveals Sasha's coffin. Then the same dramatic shit plays out, the Saviors make some gains but Maggie and the Kingdom arrive.
I would have respected them much more for this.
He was clearly trying to figure out how to say yes without offending Michonne.
To be fair, she's been dead for a while now.

I don't understand why they force the pace to be so slow.
Advertising.
I smell a stinky spin-off!
Love his reunion with Rick. He just kills someone and nods. "Yeah, I kill people now." And Rick nods back, "Cool."

It felt too much, though. I already found Negan too unbelievable. This guy would no way last in the real world. He takes too many chances. Then, in the middle of an all out firefight between three or four sizable groups, he's crackin' jokes.
They're a bunch of McPoyles.
I kind of hoped a bullet would have hit his hand. Cocky mofo.

This is stupid. It really felt like a cheap plot twist because there was no motivation for them to side with Negan. Also, after seeing Negan in action and hearing him, they should have realized this was not the partner they wanted.
It was just dumb all around. But maybe these trash people are idiots.

This is was a really good episode. It shouldn't have been, but it was. There was plenty to be upset about, but somehow it didn't matter. I think it's because of the slow burn of this season. I was desperate for something, anything, and this latest episode sort of gave us something, I think.
The big problems:
* Nobody died, other than Sasha. With all the shooting going on and utter mayhem, no one significant got killed. Major plot armor. * Nobody shot the tall garbage pail kid. She was on a watch tower in the middle of all the action and the leader of the gang. An easy and obvious target. * Nobody notices a huge fuckin' tiger sneaking up on you? * How did Negan manage to hold court in the middle of a shootout? Weird.
And yeah, basically everything relates to that shootout. How did anyone tell people apart? Why did Maggie and the tiger arrive at such a convenient time? Why does nobody think to shoot the main characters, you know the people causing all this shit in the first place?
I didn't know corporations had balls, but that does explain the weird taste in my mouth.

So how do I get the hotel perks from the CSR? It says "amenities are subject to availability at the time of check-in/departure". Will they do it automatically or do I have to request things? If so, how do I do it? "Hey, so can I get an upgrade because of my fancy ass credit card?"
Any way to ensure I'll qualify for an upgrade? What's the best hotel perk you've gotten with the CSR?

WRITING.TEXT: This is why the Constitution is crap. It's near impossible to change and is simply obsolete in modern times. During the peak of our nation building days, we drafted much better constitutions for the governments we installed, stuff completely counter to our own and stuff we could never get into it.

I'm glad it's looking like our system will fix the issue and punish those responsible, but it's really disappointing that this happened in the first place, how long it's taking to resolve and the damage already done by our illegitimate president.

Three things:
He's the cause of some of this shit. He says things, and people react.
He's unwittingly leaking classified info. He gets reports about classified info, makes a public comment based on it, and later the stuff is revealed or the consequences of the intelligence findings come to be.
The Russians are feeding him information and/or causing stuff to happen in support of him. It would be like if Putin said, "Don't worry about that Schiff guy. He won't be around much longer." And Trump tweets, "Sad to hear about Schiff. Prayers to his family." And three days later he dies in a car crash.

WRITING.TITLE: Austrian Authorities Seek Hitler Double Seen Around Birthplace

The three types of people in a bar.

WRITING.TEXT: It's not above and beyond. It's an unreasonable demand. If your sweetheart wanted you to shoot yourself, should you go above and beyond for her? Stop trying to frame it like it's part of your duty in a relationship, that's it's a give and take. There are some things you shouldn't have to give, and partners should ask those things of you.

You're completely wrong. I'm not going to pretend to be someone I'm not or take an interest in something I'm not interested in just to answer a question she has of me. And I wouldn't expect her to either. I think it's ridiculous that you feel that's part of a healthy relationship.

What's wrong with her not having a favorite team? If she knows nothing about football, but I ask her a question about it, is she expected to learn? You seem to be suggesting it's her duty to study something she has no interest in just to appease my inquiries.
Are we sure?

So you think when I ask my girlfriend her favorite team, I want her to answer with my favorite team? That's ridiculous *and* unhealthy.
They're not asking about *their* tastes. They're asking about *my* tastes. And I don't care. If it was about their tastes, they wouldn't need to ask me.
I literally have no opinion. I am indifferent. Any option is equally valid.
I'll set them down for a long talk about how I have nothing to offer in the way of fashion advice.

It's nonsensical! I can give it thought, but that doesn't change the answer. They look the same to me in whatever they're wearing. I literally do not care, not out of laziness but out of the simple fact that it does not matter to me one iota. They look the same in a red shirt as they do in a blue shirt.
The fact that you and people like you think that apathy can't be a valid answer is ridiculous. If I flipped it on them and demanded them to pick a favorite football team, would that not be equally ridiculous? Should I be mad at them for not being able to tell me who would make a better starting quarterback? If I ask them what team I should bet on, and they tell me "Whichever you think is best", should I demand they make a choice for me, one which I will be sure to hold them accountable for when the game is over?
I would hope not.

You're exactly like them. So how would I get you to shut up about it and stop asking me? You seem insistent on me having an opinion, when I seriously see no difference between a red bracelet or a blue bracelet other than the fact that yes they are different colors. How are colors inherently better than any other colors? Isn't it entirely dependent on what you wear it with? And isn't that subject to change regularly? How am I supposed to be expected to tell you which I like best when I am completely apathetic to both equally? I like them the same, as in I don't care for either, which isn't to say that I dislike them both.
How can you not understand that? How do I get it through to people like you?

WRITING.TITLE: How do I [35/M] get my mom and girlfriend to stop asking me for suggestions about stuff I have no interest in?
WRITING.TEXT:
They both ask me for suggestions often. When I have something to offer, I offer it. Sometimes I don't care or have no insight into the problem. For example, most "girly" things. They'll ask me to help pick out jewelry for each other as birthday gifts. They'll ask me my which blouse looks best. Or whatever.
I honestly do not care, and I don't think my opinion counts anyway. How am I an expert on fashion? I'm not. They should know better than me. I say thinks like, "Whichever you want" or "I don't know" or "It's not my area" and they seem to get upset.
Is there some secret to just getting them off my back about this and trusting me when I say "I don't know"?
It's not like I'm indecisive. If they ask me a question I have an opinion about or am knowledgeable about, I'll tell them what I think.
**tl;dr:** I don't have an opinion, but my mom and girlfriend try to force one out of me anyway.
Poor Texas.
Well, that's how I do.
